text: Enrique Jorge Morea (11 April 1924 - 15 March 2017)Davis Cup Profile was an Argentine tennis player. He was born in Buenos Aires. Morea won the mixed doubles title of the 1950 French Championships. He also won two Gold medals at the inaugural men's tennis competition at the 1951 Pan American Games. Lance Tingay of The Daily Telegraph ranked Morea as World No. 10 in 1953 and 1954. Until his death, Morea was the honorary president of the Asociaci√≥n Argentina de Tenis (AAT). Morea died in Buenos Aires from natural causes on 15 March 2017, aged 92. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Argentine tennis players Category:Sportspeople from Buenos Aires
title: Enrique Morea
